get.summary: Read configured profile for AP system

patch.summary: Update existing AP system profile configurations

delete.summary: Delete the profile for AP system

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

summer-time.description: Set the software clock to begin and end daylight saving time on a recurring basis.

x-enumDescriptions.FIRST: The first week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.SECOND: The second week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.THIRD: The third week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.FOURTH: The fourth week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.LAST: The last week of the month.

start-week.x-typeDescription: Enumeration for specifying the week of the month (FIRST, SECOND, THIRD, FOURTH, LAST).
start-week.description: The time change begin FIRST/SECOND/THIRD/FOURTH/LAST week of the month.

start-day.description: The weekday when the time change begin.

start-month.description: The month when the time change begin.

start-hour.description: The time, in hours and minutes, that the time change begin.

x-enumDescriptions.FIRST: The first week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.SECOND: The second week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.THIRD: The third week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.FOURTH: The fourth week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.LAST: The last week of the month.

end-week.x-typeDescription: Enumeration for specifying the week of the month (FIRST, SECOND, THIRD, FOURTH, LAST).
end-week.description: The time change end FIRST/SECOND/THIRD/FOURTH/LAST week of the month.

end-day.description: The weekday when the time change end.

end-month.description: The month when the time change end.

end-hour.description: The time, in hours and minutes, that the time change end.

led.description: Enable LED display on an AP.

led-override.description: Override the LED action for LED operation mode normal.

country-code.description: Defines the country of operation of an AP.

virtual-controller-name.description: Defines a unique name for the virtual controller.

virtual-controller-ip.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
virtual-controller-ip.description: Assigns an IP address for the virtual controller. This API is AOS8 specific.

virtual-controller-ipv6.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
virtual-controller-ipv6.description: Assigns an IPv6 address for the virtual controller. This API is AOS8 specific.

virtual-controller-vlan.description: Configures the virtual controller settings. This API is AOS8 specific.

vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
vlan.description: Associates a VLAN ID with the virtual controller.

mask.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
mask.description: Configures a subnet mask for the virtual controller.

gateway.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
gateway.description: Configures a gateway for the virtual controller.

virtual-controller-dnsip.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
virtual-controller-dnsip.description: Configures the DNS IP address for the virtual controller. This API is AOS8 specific.

allow-new-aps.description: Allows the new access points to join the AP cluster. This API is AOS8 specific.

country-code-alias.description: Alias for virtual controller country code.

vc-ip-alias.description: Alias for virtual controller ip. This API is AOS8 specific.

vc-ipv6-alias.description: Alias for virtual controller ipv6. This API is AOS8 specific.

vc-vlan-alias.description: Alias for virtual controller vlan. This API is AOS8 specific.

vc-dnsip-alias.description: Alias for virtual controller dnsip. This API is AOS8 specific.

allow-new-aps-alias.description: Alias for allow new aps. This API is AOS8 specific

items.description: Specifies the MAC address of the AP that is allowed to join the cluster. This API is AOS8 specific.

swarm-mode.description: Provision an Instant AP in the standalone, single AP, or cluster mode. This API is AOS8 specific.

x-enumDescriptions.CLUSTER: Instant AP in the cluster mode, it can form a cluster with other Virtual Controller Instant APs in the same VLAN.
x-enumDescriptions.STANDALONE: Instant AP in the standalone mode, it cannot join a cluster of Instant APs even if there are other Instant APs in the same VLAN.
x-enumDescriptions.SINGLEAP:
Instant AP in the single AP mode, it does not send or receive management frames such as mobility packets, roaming packets,
hierarchy beacons through the uplink port.

mode.x-typeDescription: Provisions the Instant AP in the standalone, single AP, or cluster mode.
mode.description:
Provisions the Instant AP in the standalone, single AP, or cluster mode.
Range: CLUSTER, STANDALONE, SINGLEAP.

conductor.description: Provisions the Instant AP as a conductor Instant AP. This API is AOS8 specific.

subnet.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

subnet-mask.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
subnet-mask.description: Subnet mask for the management subnet address.

extended-ssid.description:
This command allows you to configure additional WLAN SSIDs.
Extended SSID is enabled in the factory default settings of APs.

mas-integration.description: Enables mobility Access Switch integration on an AP.

itm.description:
Enable Intelligent Thermal Management(ITM) on the AP. When enabled, certain operations of the
AP will be throttled down to reduce its internal temperature. The limitations of AP operations
is defined by the priority assigned for reduction steps configured in Intelligent Power Monitoring(IPM)
API. IPM must be enabled for ITM to function.

x-enumDescriptions.AUTO:
Configure the AP to automatically enable or disable CPU management feature during run-time.
When configured, the AP determines the need for enabling or disabling CPU management, based
on the real-time load calculations taking into account all different functions that the CPU
needs to perform. The auto option is the default and recommended setting.
x-enumDescriptions.ENABLE:
Enable the CPU management feature. When configured, the client and network management functions
are protected. This setting helps in large networks with a high client density.
x-enumDescriptions.DISABLE: Disable the CPU management feature, typically for small networks. This setting protects the user experience.

dynamic-cpu-mgmt.description: Enable/Disable Dynamic CPU management to manage resources across different functions performed by an AP.

disable-factory-reset.description:
Disable the factory reset function on the AP. Prevent the manual hard reset to factory default by pressing
down reset button for 5 seconds.

firsthop-security.description: Disable the first hop security features on the AP. By default these security features are enabled on the AP.

drt-upgrade-disable.description: Disable the automatic download and installation of DRT updates on the AP managed by Aruba Central.

poe-power-optimization-enable.description:
Enable optimization minimizes the POE draw of the AP and may disable some parts of the AP. The USB
and Ethernet port (eth1) are shut down on the AP when this option is enabled. The AP will operate in
the full power mode when this option is disabled. It is disabled by default on the AP.

mtu.description:
Configure the MTU size for tunnel and br0 interfaces, and uplink interface such as 3G or 4G.
The configured MTU size is applied when the uplink changes.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: No DHCP Option 82 XML file will be used.
x-enumDescriptions.DEFAULT_DHCPOPT82_1_XML:
Default DHCP Option 82 XML file 1. Values for Circuit and Remote ID's are as follows:
Circuit ID: AP Name, AP MAC Address, Extended AP MAC Address,
Remote ID: User's MAC Address.
x-enumDescriptions.DEFAULT_DHCPOPT82_2_XML:
Default DHCP Option 82 XML file 2. Values for Circuit and Remote ID's are as follows:
Circuit ID: AP MAC Address, Extended AP MAC Address, SSID Tunnel,
Remote ID: User's MAC Address.
x-enumDescriptions.DEFAULT_DHCPOPT82_3_XML:
Default DHCP Option 82 XML file 3. Values for Circuit and Remote ID's are as follows:
Circuit ID: User's MAC Address,
Remote ID: AP Name, Extended AP MAC Address.

dhcp-option82-xml.x-typeDescription: Enumeration of allowed DHCP Option 82 XML file names.
dhcp-option82-xml.description:
Configure DHCP Option 82 XML file. The AP inserts circuit and remote ID information
into DHCP requests from clients.

dhcp-option82-xml-vlan-list.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
dhcp-option82-xml-vlan-list.description:
VLAN or VLAN range for which DHCP Option 82 XML applies. Allowed values: a single VLAN (1-4094)
or a range (e.g., 10-100). This leaf can only be configured when dhcp-option82-xml is set to a valid XML file.

out-of-service-hold-on-time.description:
Configure a hold on time in seconds, after which out-of-service operation is triggered.
For example, if the Internet is unreachable, the effect of this out-of-service state impacts the SSID
availability after the configured hold on time.

x-enumDescriptions.ENABLE:
This parameter enables the static LACP configuration. The AP will work on LACP mode irrespective of whether or not the
peer switch works on the LACP mode.
x-enumDescriptions.DISABLE:
This parameter disables the static LACP configuration. The AP will not work on LACP mode even it detects any LACP PDUs
from the peer switch.
x-enumDescriptions.AUTO: This parameter enables the dynamic LACP configuration. The AP will work on LACP mode only if the peer switch works on.

lacp.description:
Enable/Disable/Remove the static LACP(Link Aggregation Control Protocol) configuration.
When an AP boots up, it forms the LACP according to the static configuration.

enet-vlan.description: Configures VLAN for the upstream switch to which the AP is connected.

advertise-location.description:
Enable advertising location info in beacon frame.
Disable by default.

x-enumDescriptions.IPV4_ONLY: Enables system processing of IPv4 packets.

ip-mode.x-typeDescription: IP mode to process IPv6 or IPv4 packets.
ip-mode.description: IP mode to enable the processing of IPv4 packets globally.

module.description: List of module type, module and sub-module.

type-process-subcategory.description: Key combination of type, process and subcategory separated by '~'.

severity.x-typeDescription: Logging level upto which, the messages are logged.
severity.description:
Minimum severity for logging.
Range: EMERGENCY, ALERT, CRITICAL, ERROR, WARNING, NOTICE, INFO, DEBUG.

cluster-security.description:
Cluster Security DTLS configuration for IAP.
Enabling cluster-security dtls will form Datagram TLS connection between Conductor and Member APs.

allow-low-assurance-devices.description: Allow non-TPM (Trusted-Platform-Module) devices to connect over DTLS

allow-non-dtls-members.description: Do not allow non-DTLS enabled APs to connect

items.description:
This configures a zone name for the AP. You can configure zone settings on an AP and the SSID profile, to assign an SSID to a specific AP.
To assign an SSID to a specific AP, the AP zone name must be configured on the WLAN SSID profile.

advanced-zone.description:
Enable or disable the advanced zone feature that can configure up to 32 SSIDs.
Since the mapping method of the WLAN index and BSSID index are different,
when you change the advanced zone configuration, the BSSID is removed and created again.
When advanced zone is enabled:
 The WLAN SSID profile will remain inactive without the zone.
 The WLAN SSID profile will remain inactive without the zone.
 A zone can be assigned to a maximum of up to 16 SSIDs.
 However, if the extended SSID is disabled,
 a zone can be assigned to a maximum of up to 14 SSIDs wherein the first two virtual APs are reserved for mesh.

tx-blanking.description:
When enabled, AP supports scanning Ultra Tri-Band (UTB) blocked channels. It is used to
resolve 5GHz & 6GHz co-existence problem with interference when 5GHz UNII-4 and 6GHz UNII-5
concurrent transmission happens.

recovery-ssid-backoff-time.description:
Configures the backoff time in minutes before bringing up the recovery SSID.
When the AP disconnects from Central, the recovery SSID will be brought up after this backoff period.
The recovery SSID type can be configured in the wlan-ssid profile and provides access to the AP's troubleshooting interface.

content-filtering.description:
Content filtering configuration at system level.
This option control access to websites and applications based on their content, adding more security.

advertise-ap-health-ie.description:
Control AP to enable/disable 'Over the Air AP Rescue' feature. This feature is enabled by default.
'Over the Air AP Rescue' feature controls AP to broadcast the AP health IE through the wireless SSIDs.
The AP health IE contains many flags that can reflect current AP status like uplink status,
Central connectivity status. Once AP lost Central connection, this AP health IE can be broadcast through
wireless beacons so that our Aruba APs nearby can hear this beacon and send the AP health IE to Central.
This will allow the user or engineer to understand the status of the issue AP and take measures to rescue it.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

summer-time.description: Set the software clock to begin and end daylight saving time on a recurring basis.

x-enumDescriptions.FIRST: The first week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.SECOND: The second week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.THIRD: The third week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.FOURTH: The fourth week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.LAST: The last week of the month.

start-week.x-typeDescription: Enumeration for specifying the week of the month (FIRST, SECOND, THIRD, FOURTH, LAST).
start-week.description: The time change begin FIRST/SECOND/THIRD/FOURTH/LAST week of the month.

start-day.description: The weekday when the time change begin.

start-month.description: The month when the time change begin.

start-hour.description: The time, in hours and minutes, that the time change begin.

x-enumDescriptions.FIRST: The first week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.SECOND: The second week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.THIRD: The third week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.FOURTH: The fourth week of the month.
x-enumDescriptions.LAST: The last week of the month.

end-week.description: The time change end FIRST/SECOND/THIRD/FOURTH/LAST week of the month.

end-day.description: The weekday when the time change end.

end-month.description: The month when the time change end.

end-hour.description: The time, in hours and minutes, that the time change end.

ArubaApSystem_AuthenticationSystemApConf.description: Group for AP specific system level authentication configurations.

rfc-3576-server-udp-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.

denylist-time.description: Sets the duration in seconds for denylisting clients due to an ACL rule trigger.

preference-of-san-over-cn.description: Prefer to check the SAN string, if the SAN string has legal domain, use this domain as the Captive Portal domain.

max-pmk-cache-threshold.description: AP support the max pmk cache count.

auth-survivability-cachetime.description:
This parameter specifies the lifetime in hours for the cached access credential in the local Survival Server. When the specified cache-lifetime expires, the cached access credential is deleted from the managed device.
The default value is 24h, the time range is 1-168 for AP.

gps.description: Configure parameters for GPS (Global Positioning System) function.

x-enumDescriptions.AUTO: Set GPS function in auto mode.

state.x-typeDescription:
Control GPS working state.
There are three states: enable, auto and disable.
state.description: Configure GPS function with options AUTO/ENABLE/DISABLE, AUTO is the default config.

x-enumDescriptions.AIRBORNEV1:
GPS receiver is used by an airborne object with an acceleration of 1g (gravitational acceleration),
and that object is accelerating at a rate equal to the acceleration due to gravity on Earth.
x-enumDescriptions.AIRBORNEV2:
GPS receiver is used by an airborne object with an acceleration of 2g (gravitational acceleration),
and that object is accelerating at a rate equal to the acceleration due to gravity on Earth.
x-enumDescriptions.AIRBORNEV4:
GPS receiver is used by an airborne object with an acceleration of 2g (gravitational acceleration),
and that object is accelerating at a rate equal to the acceleration due to gravity on Earth.
x-enumDescriptions.AUTOMOTIVE: GSP receiver is used on an automobile.
x-enumDescriptions.BIKE: GPS receiver works in a bike scenario.
x-enumDescriptions.PEDESTRIAN: GPS receiver is used by a pedestrian.
x-enumDescriptions.PORTABLE: GPS receiver is used on a portable device.
x-enumDescriptions.SEA: GPS receiver is used on the sea.
x-enumDescriptions.WRIST: GPS receiver is wore on someone's wrist.

dynamic-model.x-typeDescription:
Dynamic model refers to the navigation dynamic platform model that GPS receiver uses.
It includes airborne, automative, bike, pedestrian, portable devices, sea scenario,
stationary and wearing devices.
dynamic-model.description:
Dynamic model of GPS, in which it includes options: AIRBORNEV1/AIRBORNEV2/AIRBORNEV4
/AUTOMOTIVE/BIKE/PEDESTRIAN/PORTABLE/SEA/STATIONARY/WRIST.
STATIONARY is default.

sampling-interval.description:
Interval to read GPS data from chip, an integer that from 1 to 3600, in seconds.
Deault value is 10 second

height.description:
Height of device over ground, which supports 16 fractions at most.
In meters.

min-samples.description:
Minimum number of GPS samples for the fisrt report, its value is from 1 to 100, 30 by default.
A step for the next report till the max number. For example, first reporting happens
when there are 30 samples, the nex report happens when 60 (30 + 30) samples.

max-samples.description:
Maximum number of samples for GPS ellipse report, which is from 30 to 600, 100 by default.
This value means the maxmum samples saved on APs.

retry.description:
Whether AP sends GPS reports when number of samples reaches the maximum, but no reply
from FCO (Automatic Frequency Coordination) service. This service applies channel list
and power level to enable AP 6G radio within the USA.
Disabled by default.

ellipse-report-interval.description:
Interval for ellipse report when FCO response is received.
Range is from 60 to 1440 in minutes, 360 by default.

indoor-sp-location.description:
An enhancement for Standard Power(SP) APs to obtain GPS ellipse data. When enabled,
APs are able to broadcast their GPS ellipse data in wireless packets, then neighbor APs with
poor GPS signal can use the received infomation to compute their own ellipses.

max-relay-distance.description:
A limit for accumulated distance from the AP that broadcasts original ellipse data.
If the distance is over this limit, AP will not choose this ellipse.

lci.description: Location Coordinate Information (LCI) configuration on AP.

location.description: Location information, which includes latitude, longitude and altitude.

latitude.description: AP latitude, which support 16 fractions at most, in unit of decimal degrees.

longitude.description: AP longitude, which support 16 fractions at most, in unit of decimal degrees.

x-enumDescriptions.UNKNOWN: It means an unknow measurement method.

altitude-type.x-typeDescription:
Different measurement methods for altitude in Location Coordinate Information (LCI).
It includes unknow, by meters and by floors.
altitude-type.description: Altitude type, which means how to disply altitude, in meters, in floors or unknown.

altitude.description: AP altitude, which support 16 fractions at most, in unit of decimal degrees.

x-enumDescriptions.WGS88_2: Use World Geodetic System 1984 [WGS84] coordinate reference system.
x-enumDescriptions.NAD83_NAVD88_3:
Combination of the North American Datum 1983 (NAD83) for
horizontal (Latitude and Longitude) values, plus the North
American Vertical Datum of 1988 (NAVD88) vertical datum.
x-enumDescriptions.NAD83_MLLW:
Combination of the North American Datum 1983 (NAD83) for horizontal (Latitude
and Longitude) values, plus the Mean Lower Low Water (MLLW) vertical datum.

datum.description:
Real world coordinate systems used.
1, World Geodetic System 1984 [WGS84].
2, Combination of the North American Datum 1983 (NAD83) for
   horizontal (Latitude and Longitude) values, plus the North
   American Vertical Datum of 1988 (NAVD88) vertical datum.
3, Combination of the North American Datum 1983 (NAD83) for
   horizontal (Latitude and Longitude) values, plus the Mean
   Lower Low Water (MLLW) vertical datum.

uncertainty.description: LCI uncertainty parameters for latitude, longitude and altitude.

latitude.description: Latitude uncertainty, which support 16 fractions at most, in unit of decimal degrees.

longitude.description: Longitude uncertainty, which support 16 fractions at most, in unit of decimal degrees.

altitude.description: Altitude uncertainty, which support 16 fractions at most, in unit of decimal degrees.

x-enumDescriptions.EXPECT_TO_MOVE: An object is going to move.
x-enumDescriptions.UNKNOWN: Not sure whether an object is going to move or not.

move.description: Trend of moving, which includes NO_MOVE, EXPECT_TO_MOVE and UNKNOWN.

number.description: Floor number, which is from -9512 to 9512.

height.description: Height over the specific floor, which is from -92048 to 92048.

uncertainty.description: Uncertainty in floor management, it assigns the precision.

barometer.description: Configure parameters for the barometer sensor.

enable.description: Enable/Disable reading data from barometer sensor.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
